sub_title:
Action for Change & Independent Consultant
On Crossroads to Sustainable Development
summary:
I have a MA in Human Geography of Developing Countries, University of Utrecht, the Netherlands with over 25 years experience in development work. Focus is on program management, organisational and institutional capacity building of NGO/CBOs, tripartite forums and networks,  participatory strategic planning, HIV/AIDS, gender and youth programming as well as livelihood approaches. As Technical Advisor for AIDSTAR-One (JSI) I supported USAID/PEPFAR-funded  Natural Resource Management and Economic Growth Programs including the Jane Goodall Institute, African Wildlife Foundation, FINTRAC's Tanzania Agricultural Productivity Program and Tanzania Coastal Management Partnership in mainstreaming and integrating HIV/AIDS, gender and PLME in their programs. I worked as Co-worker for the Belgian Embassy, Assistant Resident Representative for the Belgian Technical Cooperation and Technical Adviser for  award winning SERO Businesswomen Association Ltd (see https://www.selfina.com/honor-awards) and for Cooperative Education Centre Ruvuma (SNV). Working experience includes a vast amount of  consultancy assignments for the EU, UNAIDS, GIZ, PACT, COWI, Concern Worldwide, Terre des Hommes, Save the Children-UK, Royal Netherlands Embassy, ECD, African Development Fund, ActionAid Tanzania. Assignments include action research, documentation of best practices, evaluations as well as setting up and supporting networks, forum and coordinating bodies.   I have full command of English, Kiswahili and Dutch combined with experience as team leader, facilitator and catalyst for change. 

Specialties: 
Program Management, Institutional Capacity Building, PLME and documentation of best practices
Advocacy, lobbying and networking e.g. National HIV/AIDS Testing Campaign & Workplace policies 
Mainstreaming and Inclusive approaches on Gender, HIV/AIDS, Youth & Most Vulnerable Children
Economic empowerment: Live skills training, Saving & Credit, Value Chains 
Right-based approaches

education.field_of_study: 1. Extension Science  2. Gender  3. Development Economics 4. Cooperatives, Saving & Credit

organizations.name: Devex, IIG (INGOs and NGOs) and IPG group for MVC, CSO Gender Coalition

projects.title: Entrepreneurship and Enployment Promotion in Mtoni Constituency, Zanzibar (MKUAJI)
projects.description:
MKUAJI stands for “Mtoni Kuendeleza Ujasiriamali na Ajira”, translated Mtoni Entrepreneurship
and Employment Promotion. This three year program (2012-2015) has been developed and will be
implemented by the office of the Representative of Mtoni Constituency in partnership with the Centre for Entrepreneurship Training Tanzania and Action for Change Tanzania. The program will be implemented in three wards in Unguja, Zanzibar, namely Mtoni Kidatu, Mtopepo and Mtoni Mwanyanya. Action for Change Tanzania is supporting MKUAJI in developing a comprehensive 3-year program, involving entrepreneurship and vocational training, group formation, marketing, value chain development, saving and credit facilities,business advisory services and social protection such as pensions, medical insurance, legal aid, supporting education for orphans and vulnerable children ask well as HIV/AIDS prevention and preventing alcohol and drug abuse among youth. Action for Change Tanzania will also provide support in the fields organisational development and institutional capacity building e.g. developing management information and monitoring & evaluation systems.

projects.title: Gando Entrepreneurship Programme in Pemba, Zanzibar, United Republic of Tanzania April 2011 to July 2011
projects.description:
Gando Entrepreneurship Programme (GEP) in Pemba, Zanzibar is supporting especially women
entrepreneurs in Gando Constituency, building their vocational, business and marketing skills, in an effort to enable them putting them to enhance their family income and better the live of their children (boys and girls), enabling them to follow primary and even secondary education. Action for Change Tanzania provided technical support to develop a three year programme on economic empowerment.

profile_positions.description:
Change Tanzania - a local NGO, formed in order to contribute towards the national strategy for growth and reduction of poverty through capacity building of local partners in the following fields: 
- Organisational development and participatory strategic planning, project management 
- Mainstreaming HIV/AIDS, gender, youth and Most Vulnerable Children issues
- Right-based and livelihood approaches including short courses in business and vocational skills, 
   advisory services and saving and credit facilities for the most vulnerable in the community including 
   female headed households, youth, MVC, people living with HIV/AIDS and their caretakers
- Networking, lobbying and advocacy and approaches that enhance access to information, knowledge, 
   technology and skills with focus on community growth, gender, environmental protection, health 
    and economic well-being.
- Public-private partnership and social responsibility 
- Good governance
profile_positions.title: Managing Director/ Co-Founder/Lead Consultant

profile_positions.description: Consultancy assignment  for Action for Change Tanzania. Action for Change is still an outstanding invoice EURO 300 to the Lead Consultant of End Term Review Mission. He had never mentioned the deadline of the assignment, nor answered any of my questions on the assignment. He unilaterally decided to donated Euro 100 to an NGO in Malawi instead of paying Action for Change Tanzania for the services rendered. Most likely he is breaching his confidentiality agreement with the the EU and was not allowed to sub-contract. No integrity and professionalism at all. Can not advise anybody to work for or with this person. He is a complete waist of time and energy.

company.name: Technical Support Facility Eastern Africa,  UNAIDS

profile_positions.company: Technical Support Facility Eastern Africa,  UNAIDS
profile_positions.description:
International conference from Joint UN Program on AIDS/UNAIDS and the Country Capacity and Strengthening Team aiming:
- To promote a common understanding of capacity development in the context of technical support
  planning and national HIV programs
- To share country experiences and receive a status update of current Technical Support and 
  Country Development (TS/CD) planning from the six EC-funded countries identifying successes, 
  challenges, bottlenecks and gaps  
- Capacity Development Guidance Note and obtain feedback on the Guidance from countries
- To develop and strengthen six EC-funded countries draft TS/CD plans discussing implementation
  strategies, operationalisation of the plans, overcoming obstacles, and linkages with other national
  strategic planning and efforts.
profile_positions.title: Rapporteur for an International Workshop

profile_positions.description:
Supporting USAID/PEPFAR-funded supported Natural Resource Management and Economic Growth Programs including the Jane Goodall Institute, African Wildlife Foundation (AWF) , FINTRAC - Tanzania Agricultural Productivity Program (TAPP) and Tanzania Coastal Management Partnership (TCMP) in mainstreaming and integrating HIV/AIDS in their programs. 
This included among others organizing a workshop for the four implementing partners on defining mainstreaming of HIV/AIDS, gender, Monitoring and Evaluation aimed at getting all organisations on the same line, share experiences and do an needs assessment among the implementing organisations and key stakeholders using a SWOT analysis. This formed the based on developing a plan for technical support which was presented to AIDSTAR-One, PEPFAR and USAID. 
I also joined in and gave advise during a workshop organised in December 2010 by Jane Goodall Institute in Kigoma aimed at developing and improving the curriculum on HIV/AIDS and Gender, which Jane Goodall Institute used to train peer educators and beneficiaries, especially out-of-school youth enrolled in the roots and shoots campaign.
profile_positions.title: Technical Adviser on Mainstreaming HIV/AIDS in 4 PEPFAR/USAID supported Economic Growth/NRM programs
